title: Taylor Swift Addresses Hate From 'Male Sports Fans' in New Heights Clip
description: Taylor Swift poked fun on 'New Heights' at the backlash from NFL fans toward her relationship with boyfriend Travis Kelce
content:
Taylor Swift is taking aim at dads, Brads and Chads once again in a new clip from her appearance on boyfriend Travis Kelce’s “New Heights” podcast.

A preview of the Wednesday, August 13, episode featured Travis’ brother and cohost, Jason Kelce, introducing Swift, 35, by listing a multitude of accomplishments, including her recent Eras Tour and the record-breaking release of her album The Tortured Poets Department.

“Thank you for screaming for, like, 47 seconds for me. That was so nice. That was so sweet,” Swift told Jason, 37, while sitting next to Travis, 35, in the sneak peek. “Thanks for having me on my favorite podcast.”

Swift went on to joke about the mixed reaction from NFL fans about her relationship, adding, “As we all know, you guys have a lot of male sports fans that listen to your podcast. And I think we all know that if there’s one thing male sports fans want to see in their spaces and on their screens — it’s more of me.”

It’s been nearly two years since Swift became a regular presence at Kansas City Chiefs games — and helped introduce a new demographic of NFL viewers — after taking her romance with Travis public in September 2023. The league wasted no time playing into the heightened attention by using Swift’s music for promotional clips and often showing her on screen when she attended Travis’ games.

While speaking about her relationship with Travis for the first time, Swift told TIME in December 2023, “I don’t know how they know what suite I’m in. There’s a camera, like, a half-mile away, and you don’t know where it is, and you have no idea when the camera is putting you in the broadcast, so I don’t know if I’m being shown 17 times or once.”

She insisted, “I’m just there to support Travis. I have no awareness of if I’m being shown too much and pissing off a few dads, Brads and Chads.”

Jason, for his part, previously pointed out that the coverage around Swift happened because the demand is there.

“The attention’s there because the audience wants to see it,” Jason told ABC affiliate WCPO 9 in February 2024. “I mean, if people didn’t want to see it, they wouldn’t be showing it. I know that. She’s a world star, she’s the quintessential artist right now in the world, singer-songwriter, immensely talented, unbelievable role model for young women across the globe.”

Jason said it would be “foolish” of the NFL “not to show” Swift cheering for Travis considering the interest around their relationship.

Swift’s appearance on “New Heights” has been a long time coming — and coincides with the announcement of her 12th album, The Life of a Showgirl. Fans previously caught a glimpse of Swift’s sweet banter with Travis in a clip shared Monday, August 11.

“That’s such a great color on you,” Swift said in another moment from the upcoming episode, while Travis replied. “Yes, I know, it’s the color of your eyes, sweetie, that’s why we match so well.”
summary: Taylor Swift has addressed male sports fans in a new clip from her appearance on Travis Kelce's podcast, "New Heights." The episode featured Travis' brother and cohost, Jason Kelce, introducing Swift, 35, by listing her accomplishments, including her recent Eras Tour and the release of her album The Tortured Poets Department. Swift also commented on mixed reaction from NFL fans about her relationship with Travis, which she said was due to the heightened interest surrounding their relationship. The episode of New Heights is set to air on Wednesday, August 13.
shortSummary: Taylor Swift criticized male sports fans in a new clip from Travis Kelce’s podcast, emphasizing her love for him and highlighting her ongoing success.

scraped_sources.text:
Brandon Blackstock’s obituary is revealing details about his private life after his divorce from Kelly Clarkson.
“After more than 20 years in the music business, Brandon found his way back to the mountains and the cowboy way of life he always wanted to live. He found a homestead and a love in Butte, Montana,” the tribute read.
The message continued, “Brandon, along with his beautiful and loving partner in life and business, Brittney Marie Jones, started building a life, building companies, and working tirelessly to create Headwaters Livestock Auction and what will live on as his legacy, The Valley View Rodeo in Bozeman, Montana.”
The news comes days after Blackstock died at age 48 following a private battle with cancer.
“It is with great sadness that we share the news that Brandon Blackstock has passed away. Brandon bravely battled cancer for more than three years. He passed away peacefully and was surrounded by family,” a family rep told Us Weekly in a statement. “We thank you for your thoughts and prayers and ask everyone to respect the family’s privacy during this very difficult time.”
Blackstock’s cause of death was confirmed to be melanoma, a form of skin cancer, by Silver Bow County Coroner Dan Hollis. His manner of death is listed as natural causes. “Brandon Blackstock passed away peacefully at his home in Butte, Montana on August 7th under hospice care surrounded by his family,” Hollis said in a statement to People on Monday, August 11.
Blackstock is survived by his four children. He shared son Seth and daughter Savannah with ex-wife Ashworth Wells, and daughter River and son Remington with ex-wife Clarkson. (Blackstock and Clarkson were married from 2013 until she filed for divorce in 2020. The pair’s divorce was finalized in 2022.
Wells has since paid tribute to Blackstock in an emotional Instagram post shared on Friday, August 8.
“Brandon was full of charm, wit, and just an absolute gentleman who happened to wear cowboy boots, wrangler jeans, and a cowboy hat. He was by far, hands down, the best Daddy and Pa. He loved hard and he fought hard,” she wrote.
She continued, “The best thing Brandon has left for his children is they know where he is. I’ve heard it said, ‘Nothing is lost when you know where it is’ and Brandon is with Jesus his Savior. Savannah, Seth, and our grandchildren are the best parts of who Brandon and I are. Thank you all for your prayers and condolences. ✝️.”
Seth, for his part, also honored his dad alongside a series of throwback photos with Blackstock. “I lost my hero yesterday, words can’t describe how proud of you I am on raising me and your 3 other kids,” Seth wrote via Instagram on Saturday, August 9. “You were a father, a son, a brother, and most importantly my best friend.”

Queen Elizabeth II’s former press secretary, Ailsa Anderson, has some thoughts about Prince Harry.
Anderson worked alongside the late monarch for 12 years, which allowed her to form a close bond with her grandson Harry, 40, as well. The former royal family employee recalled the Duke of Sussex being a “very warm, engaging and kind person” in the U.K. documentary Prince Harry: My Terrible Year, which aired on Saturday, August 9.
Still, that doesn’t mean Anderson doesn’t have some arguably harsh words for the Duke of Sussex amid the royal family’s ongoing fallout.
“Stop being the victim and start being the hero of the piece, start writing your own script,” Anderson said in a message to Harry. “I think people are just getting a little bit tired of how Prince Harry thinks the world is against him and how awful his life is.”
She claimed that the duke is “too impulsive,” which she alluded to being the reason behind some of his recent decisions.
Anderson appeared to be referring to Harry’s bombshell interview with the BBC from earlier this year, in which the duke publicly revealed details about his continued feud with King Charles III.
“I think trust is paramount in every walk of life, if you can’t trust your family, who can you trust?” Anderson also said in the documentary.
Harry has been making headlines for the past few months as the rift between him and his father continues. After losing his appeal for government-funded security in the U.K., Harry sat down for his BBC interview and claimed that Charles, 76, “won’t speak to me.” (Harry and wife, Meghan Markle, lost security protection in the U.K. after they parted ways with the royal family in 2020 and moved across the pond to Montecito, California.)
The duke also shared his wish to reconcile with his family at the time.
“I would love reconciliation with my family. There’s no point in continuing to fight anymore,” Harry said, in part. “Life is precious. I don’t know how much longer my father has.”
He added, “There have been so many disagreements between myself and some of my family.”
Harry appeared to be referring to Charles’ ongoing cancer battle. (The king was diagnosed with an undisclosed type of cancer last year.)
There has been talk about the father and son potentially finding a path towards some type of reconciliation. However, Harry’s relationship with his brother, Prince William, is something totally different.
“I think that Harry’s relationship with his brother is a different beast than his relationship with his father,” royal expert Kristen Meinzer told Us Weekly exclusively earlier this month. “But perhaps if Charles warms more to Harry, William will feel compelled to follow his lead.”

Pamela Anderson exudes beauty and grace both on screen and at her stunning home in her native country.
The actress prefers her quiet life on Vancouver Island in British Columbia, Canada, to which she moved amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Her journey back to the area was decades in the making.
Anderson grew up in Canada but relocated to Los Angeles in 1990 to pursue modeling and acting. Ultimately, following a brief stint in France, she was drawn back to Canada around 2020, where she renovated and restored her family’s farm property into the haven that it is today.
“I bought this place over 30 years ago from my grandmother and she lived out her life here so she could distribute her wealth amongst her kids,” Anderson told CR Fashion Book in March 2024. “And then I was just living my wild life out there in L.A. and all over the place. I finally came back during COVID and thought, ‘Oh, this is the time.’”
Anderson’s love for gardening, baking, entertaining and embracing nature has grown since moving into her whimsical home.
Keep scrolling for Anderson’s quotes on her life since moving back to Canada.
On Finding Comfort
“I’d never been on a plane before when I left this island. You know, I left the island, and I went to Vancouver, and then I moved to L.A., and then I went around the world and South of France for a year before I moved home,” Anderson said in November 2022, per The Canadian Press.
She continued, “I was restless when I was here. And I had to learn how to be comfortable, just relaxing and enjoying and putting all my creative juices into this project, making this an art project, listening to other people’s ideas.”
Anderson realized that the solution to some of her problems was simple: she “just needed some Canadian roots.”
On Her Homecoming
Anderson knew she would one day return home to Canada.
“I always planned on coming home to renovate this place. And it’s fun,” she told CR Fashion Book. “There’s a lot of memories … It’s very much like a homecoming. I was very close with my grandfather, and his energy is all around me. He taught me how the trees spoke to him. And so, it’s very mythological, very primitive.”
On Finding Herself
The Baywatch alum wanted to begin a new chapter in her personal life and career, prompting her move from L.A.
“I guess a homecoming, you could say, to really kind of look at my life and remember who I was — not what other people were telling me I was — and I didn’t want anything that had happened to me define me,” Anderson told Women’s Wear Daily in October 2024. “I wanted what I do to define me … all these realizations came to me in the rose garden.”
On Making a Big Change
Anderson spoke about a transitional period in her life two years after her divorce from Dan Hayhurst. The pair were married from 2020 to 2022.
“A few years back, I kind of gave up at some point and needed a change,” the Naked Gun actress told Better Homes & Gardens in August 2024. “I thought, ‘Well, I guess that’s just what people think of me.’ I was not in a good space when I moved back to Canada. I don’t know what happened over the last few decades, but I feel now so far removed from the image of who I was.”
She continued, “I felt very sad and lonely. I didn’t feel just misunderstood, I felt like I had really screwed up, that my whole life was a bundle of mistakes. I was hard on myself, and I thought I put my family through a lot and put my kids through so much.” (Anderson shares kids Brandon and Dylan Lee with ex-husband Tommy Lee.)
“I came to a point where I decided to move home and disappear and get into my garden,” she concluded. “And when I started building the garden, it was really like a metaphor of putting my life back together. I began planting seeds, and the smallest things became really profound.”
On Her Love for Gardening
Anderson’s green thumb is something she inherited from her family.
“It comes from my grandfather Herman. He was really interesting and the closest person to me as a child,” she told Better Homes & Gardens. “He was very much into mythology and fairy tales, and we always spoke about them when I was little. He would put little mirrors around in the garden, and he told me that was a way I could catch a glimpse of fairies and elves.”
She added, “I have a little collection of marbles and little toys that I still find in the garden. And I think, ‘Did I put those there as a child for my future self?’ Believe me, I’ve gone crazy with all this. Do you realize that this place that I bought from my grandmother is the same place my parents brought me home from the hospital when I was born? There were nine cabins, and we lived in cabin six. This is the first place my feet touched the actual soil.”
On Her Passion for Baking
One thing that has helped Anderson turn her house into a home is baking delicious treats.
“This bread thing is such a meditation for me,” she told Better Homes & Gardens. “You’re always on the search for the best loaf and it never comes. There’s something about it that I compare to giving birth. If all those other people have done it, then so can I. Baking teaches patience. I’ve come to realize there’s so much about cooking that is good for you. If you like to cook, you’re good at lots of things.”

Taylor Swift
Singer-songwriter Taylor Swift, who was raised on a Christmas tree farm in Pennsylvania, was first introduced to music by her grandmother, a professional opera singer. Swift began competing in karaoke contests at the age of 10 and learned the guitar at 12.
After her family relocated to Tennessee so she could pursue music, Swift was discovered at a cafe and was offered a record deal. Her first single, “Tim McGraw,” peaked at No. 6 on the Billboard charts and served as the lead track for her thrice Platinum-selling self-titled debut album, released in 2006.
Swift gradually shifted her sound from country to pop and released four more albums — Fearless in 2008, Speak Now in 2010, Red in 2012 and 1989 in 2014. The enormous success of the latter three earned her a world record as the first act to have three million-selling weeks on the Billboard 200 albums chart.
After a brief hiatus from the spotlight, she dropped her Reputation album in 2017. She released Lover two years later, which she followed up with two surprise albums in 2020, Folklore and Evermore. Swift released her 10th studio album, Midnights, in October 2022.
Through the years, Swift has won 12 Grammys and was honored in the Songwriters Hall of Fame. She was also the star of her own documentary, Miss Americana, which premiered on Netflix in 2020.
Swift released her first rerecorded album, Fearless (Taylor’s Version) in April 2021. The project began following a dispute with Scooter Braun over his purchase of the rights to her masters for more than $300 million from Big Machine Records’ Scott Borchetta. She went on to release Red (Taylor’s Version) and Speak Now (Taylor’s Version) in November 2021 and July 2023, respectively. The latter helped her break the record for the most No. 1 albums by a woman. Swift officially announced 1989 (Taylor’s Version) at her final Eras Tour concert in Los Angeles in August 2023.
Swift has been romantically associated with many high-profile men, including Joe Jonas, Taylor Lautner, Jake Gyllenhaal, John Mayer, Harry Styles, Calvin Harris and Tom Hiddleston, and has often written about her relationships in her songs.
In 2017, Swift began dating English actor Joe Alwyn. The pair kept their relationship as private as possible, with Swift revealing in 2020 that her then-boyfriend helped her cowrite songs on both Folklore and Evermore amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Us confirmed their split in April 2023.
Swift went on to briefly date The 1975’s Matty Healy before being linked to Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce in September 2023.

Travis Kelce has opened up about his relationship with Taylor Swift, revealing how she’s been a positive force in his NFL career.
Kelce, 35, gushed about Swift, 35, during an interview on “The Stephen A. Smith Show,” which aired on Wednesday, January 15.
“She’s fully encouraging me to enjoy playing this game,” Kelce said. “She loves coming to Arrowhead [Stadium] and coming to the games and cheering for me, so I got all the support in the world to keep chasing these dreams.”
He continued, “I think, personally, the beauty of being in a very strong relationship is that you get that support to be able to come in and focus on your craft, focus on being the best version of you.”
The support goes both ways in their relationship. “That’s why I wanted to be at [her] concerts supporting her and being there for her, making sure she feels comfortable and supported in everything she’s doing in life,” Kelce gushed.
At another point in the interview, the Kansas City Chiefs tight end addressed speculation over when he would retire, saying his opinion on the subject “changes every single day.”
“I’ll reevaluate it like I always do, and I’ll probably tell myself how much I love this thing, and come back next year,” he said. “But it’s just something you have to keep in perspective, and I never want to get to the point where I’m not helping this team win or I’m hurting this team more than I’m helping this team.”
It’s not the first time Kelce has opened up about the prospect of retirement. Speaking to KMBC 9 in June 2024, the football star said he “can’t put a timeframe on it.”
“I know there are opportunities outside of football for me,” he said. (Over the past year, Kelce has expanded his horizons beyond the sports world, even trying his hand at acting on FX’s Grotesquerie.)
“I love coming to work every single day, doing this. I’m going to do it until the wheels fall off and hopefully that doesn’t happen anytime soon,” he added.
Kelce and Swift were first linked in July 2023, when Kelce revealed on his “New Heights” podcast that he attempted to give Swift a friendship bracelet with his phone number on it at The Eras Tour in Kansas City. Though Kelce didn’t get to meet Swift at the time, the pair later connected, and their relationship was made public when Swift attended a Chiefs vs. Chicago Bears game in September 2023.
Since then, the couple have continued to support each other publicly, with Swift attending multiple Chiefs games — including the 2024 Super Bowl. Kelce, for his part, has attended several of Swift’s shows and even made an appearance on stage at The Eras Tour in London last summer.

Travis Kelce offered a new glimpse into how his connection with Taylor Swift evolved into a serious relationship.
“Whenever I’m with her, it feels like we’re just regular people,” Kelce, 35, said in his GQ cover story, which was published on Tuesday, August 12. “When there is not a camera on us, we’re just two people that are in love.”
Kelce acknowledged the endless speculation about his romance with Swift, 35, adding, “It can be perceived as something else because of how much it is talked about and how much we are tracked whenever we do go out, but I would say that it’s as normal of …”
While reflecting on the early days in their relationship, Kelce pointed out how nothing felt forced.
“It happened very organically even though from a media standpoint it was being tracked,” he noted. “It still happened very organically.”
The Kansas City Chiefs player looked back fondly at how his crush on Swift turned into an official relationship, saying, “Nothing I’ve ever done has been a controlled, organized process. When I say it was so organic, we fell in love just based off the people we were sitting in a room together with.”
Kelce went on to explain how he and Swift have sustained their connection.
“We are two fun-loving people who have the morals to appreciate everyone for who they are. We share all those values. It kind of just took the f*** off,” he continued. “Nowadays, I just want to be respected and loved by the people that I’m surrounded by in my work. I want to leave it better than where it was when I started. And I see her having those same values.”
As Swifties know, Kelce initially opened up in July 2023 about trying to make a move during one of Swift’s Eras Tour shows.
“Well, I was disappointed that she doesn’t talk before or after her shows because she has to save her voice for the 44 songs that she sings,” Travis told brother Jason Kelce on their “New Heights” podcast at the time. “So I was a little butthurt, I didn’t get to hand her one of the bracelets I made for her. She doesn’t meet anybody — or at least she didn’t want to meet me, so I took it personal. But it was an unbelievable show. Kansas City showed out.”
Two months later, Swift took fans by surprise when she showed up to support Travis at a Chiefs game.
“We actually had a significant amount of time that no one knew, which I’m grateful for, because we got to get to know each other,” Swift explained of her relationship with Travis in a November 2023 interview with TIME. “By the time I went to that first game, we were a couple. I think some people think that they saw our first date at that game? We would never be psychotic enough to hard launch a first date.”
Swift also defended their frequent public outings as their romance continued to blossom.
“When you say a relationship is public, that means I’m going to see him do what he loves, we’re showing up for each other, other people are there and we don’t care,” she added at the time. “The opposite of that is you have to go to an extreme amount of effort to make sure no one knows that you’re seeing someone. And we’re just proud of each other.”
After two years of dating, Swift and Travis recently took the next step in their relationship when the singer recorded an episode of his podcast. The highly-anticipated conversation is set to be released on Wednesday, August 13, and pegged to her upcoming new album, The Life of a Showgirl.

Product Summary: JUNG KWAN JANG Everytime Korean Red Ginseng Extract 1,050mg & Lemon - Vegan Energy Drink Liquid Stick Supplements - Builds Stamina & Immunity, Non-GMO (10 Sticks, 0.34 fl oz)
From JUNG KWAN JANG
About this Item
- PUREST FORM OF KOREAN RED GINSENG. Awaken your strength with the time-honored tradition of Korean ginseng supplement, mindfully cultivated and harvested to develop high concentrations of Ginsenosides. The treasured roots are steamed and dried to preserve its strength, supporting energy, endurance, and mental performance—a testament to centuries of craftsmanship!
- A WELL-BALANCED WELLNESS BLEND. Infused with the revitalizing power of 1,050mg Red Ginseng real Lemon Juice Concentrate, our Korean ginseng drink supports both body and mind while reinforcing immune function. It helps reduce fatigue, support circulation, sharpen memory, and contribute to overall well-being.
- PORTABLE & GREAT FOR PICK ME UP. Feeling drained? Get the boost without the crash with Everytime! Each compact red ginseng liquid stick fits effortlessly into your routine—whether you're at work, hitting the gym, or traveling. Each 0.34 fl oz (10ml) stick delivers a convenient 1-tablespoon serving—just one a day for an easy boost, where great taste meets function!
- REFRESHING TASTE & QUICK ABSORPTION. Mindfully crafted for a gentler, more enjoyable experience, this red ginseng supplement is less bitter and subtly sweetened with a zesty burst of real lemon for a refreshing twist. The fast-absorbing formula delivers results more quickly than traditional pills or gummies—no water required!
- OVER A CENTURY OF TRUSTED EXPERTISE. With over 125 years of expertise, Jung Kwan Jang upholds the highest standards from soil selection to production, earning trust across generations. Made from carefully chosen roots for potency and purity, this caffeine-free, vegan-friendly ginseng energy drink delivers the pure essence of Red Ginseng in every serving.

Travis Kelce has converted Taylor Swift into the ultimate NFL supporter.
“I sort of made her a football fan,” Kelce, 35, said in a GQ profile, published on Tuesday, August 12. “She is the most engulfed fan now. She knows what the injury reports look like. She understands what special situations are, third and short — all these things because she just naturally loves to hear about my job.”
Despite the clear differences in their careers, Kelce said that he and Swift, 35, actually have a lot in common.
“I hadn’t experienced somebody in the same shoes as me, having a partner who understands the scrutiny, understands the ups and downs of being in front of millions,” he continued. “That was very relatable, seeing how exhausted she would get after shows.”
Kelce noted that Swift will “never” compare herself to an athlete — but there’s something to be said about the physical toll touring takes.
“I’ve seen what she goes through,” he said. “I’ve seen the amount of work that she puts on her body, and it’s mind-blowing.”
While most headlines have been about Swift’s preparation for the behemoth that was the Eras Tour (the singer practiced the entire set while running on the treadmill), Kelce was focused on something else during every show.
“To go out on a stage, on a computer, essentially, for three hours,” he explained. “The [Eras Tour] floor is literally — I’ve seen underneath that thing. It is a football-field-sized computer.”
Kelce continued, “You take that into Singapore, where it is scorching hot, and all of a sudden, you’re feeling the fumes from the computer and you’re feeling the fumes from the sun and you’re doing a show for three hours with a lot of energy, bringing it every single song. That is arguably more exhausting than how much I put in on a Sunday, and she’s doing it three, four, five days in a row.”
Kelce was spotted in the crowd during various tour stops on Swift’s Eras Tour, even going as far as to appear on stage with his girlfriend after “I Can Do It With a Broken Heart” in June 2024. (Next month will mark the two-year anniversary of Kelce and Swift taking their relationship public.)
The Kansas City Chiefs tight end also revealed what he’s learned from Swift after watching her dominate the stage.
“People gravitate towards how she performs and how she makes it feel like the entire stadium is in this little room with her,” he gushed. “She is so good at mesmerizing everybody and making everybody feel like it’s an intimate situation. I think that alone — there is so much calm and coolness. She’s beautiful. She’s up there making everyone feel at ease.”
Fans who are looking for more from Swift and Kelce this week are in luck as she’s set to make her first appearance on his “New Heights” podcast on Wednesday, August 13.

The official cause of death for Kelly Clarkson’s ex-husband, Brandon Blackstock, has been confirmed.
Silver Bow County Coroner Dan Hollis told Us Weekly on Monday, August 11, that Blackstock’s cause of death was melanoma, a form of skin cancer, and the manner of his death was natural causes. “Brandon Blackstock passed away peacefully at his home in Butte, Montana on August 7th under hospice care surrounded by his family,” Hollis said in a statement.
Blackstock died on August 7 after privately battling cancer for three years. He was 48.
“It is with great sadness that we share the news that Brandon Blackstock has passed away. Brandon bravely battled cancer for more than three years. He passed away peacefully and was surrounded by family,” a family rep told Us in a statement. “We thank you for your thoughts and prayers and ask everyone to respect the family’s privacy during this very difficult time.”
One day earlier, Clarkson, 43, alerted fans to Blackstock’s illness when she put her Las Vegas residency on pause, though she didn’t reveal the nature of his condition at the time.
“Unfortunately, I need to postpone the remainder of the August Studio Session dates in Las Vegas,” she announced via Instagram on August 6. “While I normally keep my personal life private, this past year, my children’s father has been ill and at this moment, I need to be fully present for them. I am sincerely sorry to everyone who bought tickets to the shows and I so appreciate your grace, kindness and understanding.”
Clarkson and Blackstock wed in October 2013 and went on to welcome daughter River, 11, and son Remington, 9. During their marriage, Blackstock worked as the singer’s manager. Clarkson ultimately filed for divorce in June 2020 after nearly seven years. The pair finalized the proceedings in March 2022 following a messy legal battle.
Prior to his relationship with Clarkson, Blackstock was married to Melissa Ashworth from 2001 to 2012. The exes shared daughter Savannah, 23, and son Seth, 18.
In January 2022, Blackstock became a first-time grandfather when Savannah gave birth to her and now-husband Quentin Lee’s son, Lake. Savannah announced in July that the couple are expecting their second baby.
Outside of his marriage to Clarkson, Brandon had another Hollywood connection via his father, Narvel Blackstock, who was Clarkson’s manager earlier in her career. Narvel was previously married to Reba McEntire from 1989 to 2015, during which time she was stepmom to Brandon and his two sisters, Chassidy and Shawna. Narvel and McEntire’s son, Shelby, who was born in 1990, was Brandon’s half-brother.

Brandon Blackstock‘s son Seth and ex-wife Melissa Ashworth Wells have spoken out about the talent manager’s death.
“I lost my hero yesterday, words can’t describe how proud of you I am on raising me and your 3 other kids,” Seth, 18, wrote via Instagram on Saturday, August 9, alongside a series of throwback photos with his late dad. “You were a father, a son, a brother, and most importantly my best friend.”
Seth shared that while his father is no longer with him physically, his spirit will live on in other ways.
“You’ll have to watch me grow up from a Birds Eye view now but that’s OK with me. There’s no one else on this earth that I would want to be my dad because no one can be half the man you were to me,” he continued. “I’ll see you everyday when the sun rises and falls. I can confidently say all the deer and elk took a sigh of relief when the best hunter I’ve ever known laid his rifle down for the last time.”
“I love you so much and can’t wait to throw a line in the water with you again. Love you dad. Be good or good at it -love your son Seth,” he concluded.
Brandon welcomed Seth with Ashworth Wells in 2007. The exes, who were married from 1999 to 2012, also shared daughter Savannah, 23. Savannah, for her part, shares son Lake with husband Quentin Lee. Following his split from Ashworth Wells, Brandon moved on with Kelly Clarkson. The pair tied the knot in October 2013 and went on to welcome daughter River, 11, and son Remington, 9. Clarkson filed for divorce in 2020 after seven years of marriage.
One day before Seth’s tribute, Ashworth Wells shared an emotional post dedicated to Brandon.
“Brandon was full of charm, wit, and just an absolute gentleman who happened to wear cowboy boots, wrangler jeans, and a cowboy hat. He was by far, hands down, the best Daddy and Pa. He loved hard and he fought hard,” she wrote via Instagram on Friday, August 8. “The best thing Brandon has left for his children is they know where he is. I’ve heard it said, ‘Nothing is lost when you know where it is’ and Brandon is with Jesus his Savior. Savannah, Seth, and our grandchildren are the best parts of who Brandon and I are. Thank you all for your prayers and condolences. ✝️.”
Brandon died on August 7 following a private battle with cancer.
“It is with great sadness that we share the news that Brandon Blackstock has passed away. Brandon bravely battled cancer for more than three years. He passed away peacefully and was surrounded by family,” a family rep told Us Weekly in a statement. “We thank you for your thoughts and prayers and ask everyone to respect the family’s privacy during this very difficult time.”
Brandon’s cause of death was due to melanoma, which is a form of skin cancer, and the manner of his death was natural causes.

argos_summary: Taylor Swift recently appeared on the "New Heights" podcast hosted by her boyfriend Travis Kelce and his brother Jason, where she humorously addressed the mixed reactions from NFL fans regarding her relationship with Kelce. Swift expressed gratitude for the support she receives at games and acknowledged the attention her presence brings to the NFL. In a separate segment, the article also covers the passing of Brandon Blackstock, Kelly Clarkson's ex-husband, who died from melanoma at age 48, with tributes from his family highlighting his legacy and impact.
